author: sky.cactus
content: My recommendation in the last EIPIP call (when this was brought up) was that it *shouldn't* be merged because it shouldn't live in the EIPs repository.  Specifically, I think this should be added to the ETH2.0-specs repository (if possible, need to coordinate with them) because that will *hopefully* be the long term living place for Ethereum specifications and the JSON-RPC endpoints are in a perfect position to move over there since they effectively don't exist as EIPs really at all right now.

author: sky.cactus
content: The expectation is that long term, the two repos will probably merge since there isn't really such a thing as ETH1 and ETH2 after The Merge, there is just Ethereum.

author: sky.cactus
content: ETH2 specs repo is full of specs, while eth1.0-specs repo just has some hardfork coordination stuff.  This means that when the two repositories merge, it will probably be eth1.0-specs merging into eth2.0-specs.  In order to avoid having to moving everything related to JSON-RPC (which will include breaking links, losing active PRs, issues, etc.) it seemed most prudent to just have the JSON-RPC specs *start* in the eth2.0-specs repository.

author: sky.cactus
content: I'm open to other alternatives, though I *do* think that the EIPs repository is not the right place for the JSON-RPC specs.  In fact, we have been starting to talk about a long term plan of just deprecating the EIPs process in general in favor of a process more akin to how the eth2.0-specs repository is run but that is much harder for Core EIPs which are very well established.  Interface EIPs (JSON-RPC specifically) is much easier since there are so few existing "specs" in the EIPs repository.

author: sky.cactus
content: Also, we have received comments that the EIP process is rather slow and this is burdensome for interface changes which don't need to be quite as strict/stringent/careful as consensus changes, and so having them follow a different (ideally newer/better) process makes sense.

author: sky.cactus
content: Again, I apologize that this wasn't communicated clearly in the previous meetings.  I thought we were in agreement on "not EIPs repository", which it sounds like was a misunderstanding on my part.
